intro: Pilosella serpyllifolia, commonly known as common yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and along roadsides, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers bloom in early summer, producing a showy display of white or pale yellow petals.
